etymologies: mid 17th century: from Italian, plural of broccolo ‘cabbage sprout, head’, diminutive of brocco ‘shoot’, based on Latin brocchus, broccus ‘projecting’

definitions: a cultivated variety of cabbage bearing heads of green or purplish flower buds that are eaten as a vegetable.

notes.text: There are several kinds of broccoli, in particular those in the “Italica” group

shortDefinitions: cultivated variety of cabbage eaten as vegetable
